intro: Castilleja pallescens var. pallescens, commonly known as the paleleaf stickseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are small, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and usually pink or red. The species is characterized by its hemiparasitic nature, deriving some nutrients from its host plants while performing photosynthesis.
